content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– Burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed using direction RIGHT at the factory interface
– Companion burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5) that participates in the input chain
– Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5) intended for copper cable production

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest acting as the belt depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
– Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(4.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) using direction UP (with pickup at 3.5,15.5 and drop at 3.5,13.5)

### Extraction System Interface at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Errors when connecting transport belts to an invalid target  
 – Transport belts were repeatedly attempted to be connected directly to a SteamEngine. To mitigate this, always verify that the target entity is suitable for belt input and add an inserter to feed items into the target rather than connecting to a SteamEngine directly.

• Errors due to placement distance limitations  
 – An error occurred when trying to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) while the player was too far away. Ensure the player is within the allowed maximum placement distance before attempting to place an entity.

• Name resolution errors  
 – A NameError (“target_chest” not defined) indicates that a referenced variable was not properly declared. Confirm that all variables are defined and correctly named before use.

• Errors caused by insufficient inventory  
 – An attempt to place a wooden chest failed because the required item was not available in the inventory. Always check inventory counts or craft the needed item prior to placement.
